meanings.sent1: The scientist studied the embryons under the microscope.
meanings.sent2: The doctor carefully monitored the growth of the embryons in the mother's womb.
meanings.sent3: The embryons seemed to be having a dance party in the ultrasound image.
meanings.sent4: The future possibilities of the embryons were as vast as the universe.
meanings.sent5: The fragility of the embryons reminded everyone of the miracle of life.

meanings.definition: A rudimentary or undeveloped form of something.
meanings.sent1: The artist sketched out the embryons of his new painting.
meanings.sent2: The project was just in the embryons of planning, with many details still to be worked out.
meanings.sent3: The embryons of the idea were slowly taking shape in his mind.
meanings.sent4: Her dream of becoming a singer was still in the embryons, waiting to be nurtured.
meanings.sent5: The embryons of change were stirring in the community, hinting at a brighter future.
